oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Hohenwald Colored School

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee; African Americans - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of the Hohenwald Colored School in Lewis County. Originally a church, the school has a bell tower, three long windows, and a front door.

This simple one-room wooden building was originally a church and was used as a school beginning in the early 1920s. Its first teacher was Ms. Ella Gray Allison, who continued teaching for over forty years. It was replaced by a "Rosenwald school" in 1929.
